Paper.Title: amp;quot; L e x i f a n i s " A Lexical Analyzer of Modern Greek

Section.Paragraph: In Linguistics the systematic identification of the word classes rises several questions in regard to the morphemic analysis. In Computational Linguistics several research areas use fundamental information such as the "word class" of a given wordy isolated or in its context.
In Computer Science the automatic processing of Greek texts is based on relevant knowledge, at the lexical level.

In an effort to present a software tool intended to identify the grammatical classes of the words we have designed and implemented Lexifanis. We have used modern greek texts as a test-bed of our system, but Lexifanis, can process any "variant" of modern greek, and even ancient greek language, provided that it is appropriately initialized.

In this paper s whenever we use the term greek or greek language we refer to the modern greek language (~AnuoTL}::~') in its recent monotonic version (i.e. a single accent is used, instead of three, and there are no breathings --~n~'C/O~,=T,=')
